intro: Protium gileadense, commonly known as the Gilead sand-forest tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The tree produces a smooth, pale yellow fruit with a thick, fleshy pulp that is edible. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties. Protium gileadense plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
